page.title: 12AN ARABLE FARMER IN ELMSTEAD
page.content: Some children went to interview the owner of{Elmstead Hall.}He has lived there for 66 years.The new{bypass}has split up the farm and a{bridge}was built so he could reach his{fields}on the other side.{Seeds}have to be sown in the right month. The crops that the owner grows are barley,potatoes,sugar- beet,apples and peas.The{weather}is very important to him.He grows rather {special peas.}They are sent to{Japan where they roast and eat them. The owner of Elmstead Hall has 37 {employees,}7 workers are permanent,and 30 are apple pickers.The owner does {crop rotation}every year.In the summer he{harvests}his potatoes, wheat and barley.In the late autumn he pulls the sugar beet and picks apples.He farms {400 acres.}
